greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Sum of cube divisors of n.
comment: Multiplicative with a(p^e) = (p^(3*(1+floor(e/3)))-1)/(p^3-1). The Dirichlet generating function is zeta(s)*zeta(3s-3). The sequence is the inverse Mobius transform of n*A010057(n). - _R. J. Mathar_, Feb 18 2011
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..19683
R. J. Mathar, Survey of Dirichlet series of multiplicative arithmetic functions, arXiv:1106.4038 [math.NT] (2011), Remark 15.
Index entries for sequences related to sums of divisors
formula: G.f.: Sum_{k>=1} k^3*x^(k^3)/(1 - x^(k^3)). - _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, Dec 24 2016
Sum_{k=1..n} a(k) ~ zeta(4/3)*n^(4/3)/4 - n/2. - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Dec 01 2020
mathematica: f[p_, e_] := (p^(3*(1 + Floor[e/3])) - 1)/(p^3 - 1); a[1] = 1; a[n_] := Times @@ f @@@ FactorInteger[n]; Array[a, 100] (* _Amiram Eldar_, May 01 2020 *)
program: ;; With memoization-macro definec, after the multiplicative formula of _R. J. Mathar_:
results.author: _Paul Barry_, Oct 13 2005
